comments.commentBody: This will be the last time the Yankees will make the playoffs for at least 4 years in my estimation. There is a major rebuilding effort to made... I think most Yankee fans in the Tri-State are not aware for whats in store for them the next few years- Losing.

Girardi intentionally walked the go-ahead run. Is anyone watching? Might as well divide your troops in the face of the enemy or text your parts to somebody. It's high up on the list of things NOT to do.
The sorest of losers, "Old Ironsides" McCain, continues to exhibit his total lack of credibility. He should have retired to the collection of (how many) homes owned by his Miss Budweiser wife.

Why is it now one gets it...he said his constituents requested it.  Is that hard to understand?  for most it isn't, because their Senators and Represtatives are pretty much autonomous; they vote themselves huge salaries, lifetime retirement for having done nothing...and they continue on as good ole boys.  Why not change this?  Want big change? get a all new faces in congress.
Swing and a miss, Augie.   I know you can make up better things than that.

God Bless us every one if the likes of Palin and O'Donnell are the best this country has to offer.  They crack me up with their anti-intellectual blather- do Americans really want uneducated, vapid people with no experience whatsoever being in charge of our nation at such a crucial point?  Obama saved this nation from total economic disaster and has accomplished amazing things as President for the regular American people- we outnumber these wealth seeing selfish corporate mouthpieces who are only there because some rich guy is paying their way so he can stop the US from helping to stop global climate change ( their profits are more important) from educating our kids to compete in the world ( they can afford fancy private schools so what do they care? ) from protecting our elderly and their dignity with social security and medicare ( how many of those trying to destroy our most successful social programs own parents are on social security or medicare? )  I am so sick of these people getting all the press attention.  Palin is as much freak and object of jokes than politician and this bimbo is just the same.  No substance but the right wing media give them both so much coverage you would think they had some kind of meaningful solutions - they have none.

When George S. asked McCain about Boxer, McCain quoted Sen. Reed as saying something he did not agree with.  Sen. McCain, I come from a military family and I'm not sure all military spending and wars are justified.  What does that make me?

Rand Paul showed his true Tea Party colors by walking off the stage in a huff after the debate.  These people know nothing but rage and sanctimony.  Even if you strip away their sanctimony and intellectual dishonesty they still appear to be not very nice people.

To jacobi at Post #15 who said, "Not looking good for Reid!"

Not true jacobi. You're from Nevada, so you should be familiar with the polls, or perhaps you should at least widen the people you hang out with other than family. The Real Clear Politics average (10/1 - 10/17) has Sharia "Wrong" Angle with a measly 0.4% lead over Senate Majority Leader Harry Reid, 45.6% - 45.2%.

Here is the link to the website: http://www.realclearpolitics.com...

And although Angle pulled in over $14 million in the 3rd quarter that has permitted her to keep the race close, as another article here today pointed out, she has practically no money left to spend. Her gaffe last Friday speaking to Hispanic students are not going to keep Hispanics at home. An Hispanic boycott is very wishful thinking on your part.

Nice try jacobi, but we're not fooled by your post trying to deceive us into thinking Reid will lose or that the race is lost.

The Nevada Senate race is very much in play. In addition, RCP just added Kentucky as a toss-up. The gap between Rand Paul and Jack Conway is the narrowest since July. Paul is dropping fast and Conway is moving up and is only a few points behind him. This Republican seat is in danger.
.

So what if he requested funds from the stimulus package that he opposed? The stimulus will have to be repaid by all taxpayers, including those in his state, whether they approved of the bill or not, so there is no reason why they should not benefit from it.

I cannot understand the level of vitriol against McCain that is expressed in the above posts -- the fact that you guys won does not appear to be enough for you.

I'm a small businessman and I've already voted.  I voted for independents and conservatives - anyone who would stand up to the public employee unions in California.  My wife has been looking for a new job since March 2009.  We can't wait to see prosperity restored and Democrats tossed from office...

The mere fact that the Obama- Reid linkage is what made the mess we are in...is proof enough that he must be rejected by the good people of Nevada...the Ritz-Carlton is secondary.

Harry Reid is by far, closer to President Obama, than anyone else in Congress.

Following up on #23 . . .

Very difficult to estimate depth of well by size of bucket (Charlie Chan).
Stick a fork in him.  That baked horseflesh is done.

Michael--

I did look at the page from factcheck.org. Here are the first few paragraphs of it. I wouldn't describe them as helpful to Grayson:

* * *

After two false ads, Democratic Rep. Alan Grayson of Florida finally gets it right.

Grayson, whom we criticized for twisting the words of his opponent in a TV ad called "Taliban Dan," released a new ad Oct. 6 called "The Facts" and invited the media to review it. We did.

This time he mostly sticks to the facts and doesn’t resort to doctored evidence.

The narrator — a woman — lays out what she says are facts about Republican candidate Daniel Webster’s record regarding women. We’ll take the main points in order.

‘Covenant’ Marriage?

The ad says, "Fact: Webster sponsored a bill to create a form of marriage that would trap women in an abusive relationship." This is true, although he sponsored it two decades ago, and it didn’t pass.

* * *

So:

Most importantly, Grayson, according to factcheck, is a liar and did present doctored evidence on more than one occasion. On his third try, he did present, shall we say, severely edited evidence that his opponent submitted a bill [NOTE: 20 years ago, that didn't pass] that would have provided [NOTE: as a voluntary option] for a form of marriage in which adultery was the sole ground for divorce, so that a woman [NOTE: or man] in an abusive relationship could not get a divorce on those grounds [NOTE: though I assume laws against battery would continue to exist--the whole thing is moot anyway].

There's a good deal more on the same order as this, but who cares?

Next--you ask me about Anderson Cooper. I don't know what I'm supposed to do with that. I didn't cite Cooper, I didn't hear him, I have no idea what he said, I don't know how he got into this discussion and I have no position about him whatever. NOTE: I'm assuming Anderson Cooper is male as I write this, but I don't even know that.

Back to Grayson: he claims (under the withering interrogation of Ed Schultz) that 20 percent of all outside money in this election is directed against him. Really. There are 37 Senate contests, about the same number of governorships and 435 House contests, and 20 percent of the money is aimed at Alan? Do you buy that, or do you consider him a liar and a loudmouth, as I do?

I could go on (and on), touching on boorishness and so forth, but enough--over to you.

Mr. Shear's description of some of this year's candidates as "highly unusual" is quite kind to them. I used to think that low turn out primaries were to blame - where only the core base of each party voted. I'm now beginning to think that maybe these are the type of people attracted to public office in the first place.

McCain has gone from Maverick to Hack. What a horrible legacy...This guy is at the end of his career...I guess that shfting into party statesman is too tough for him to handle...Much easier to just memorize the talking points that Repub Central provides him..

WHat a loss of a career.
I knew he lost his sanity when he took on Sarah P as his 2008 running mate.  He's getting worse every year!

Congressional Reform Act of 2010 (as received via e-mail)
1)Term Limits.
12 years only, one of the possible options below..
A. Two Six-year Senate terms
B. Six Two-year House terms
C. One Six-year Senate term and three Two-Year House terms
2)No Tenure / No Pension.
A Congressman collects a salary while in office and receives no pay when they are out of office.
3)Congress (past, present & future) participates in Social Security.
All funds in the Congressional retirement fund move to the Social Security system immediately. All future funds flow into the Social Security system, and Congress participates with the American people.
4)Congress can purchase their own retirement plan, just as all Americans do.
5)Congress will no longer vote themselves a pay raise. Congressional pay will rise by the lower of CPI or 3%.
6)Congress loses their current health care system and participates in the same health care system as the American people.
7)Congress must equally abide by all laws they impose on the American people.
8) ll contracts with past and present Congressmen are void effective 1/1/11.
The American people did not make this contract with Congressmen. Congressmen made all these contracts for themselves. Serving in Congress is an honor, not a career. The Founding Fathers envisioned citizen legislators, serve your term(s), then go home and back to work.
This is America, a democratic country and we have a choices.
Vote wisely. Remember, the Obama administration inherited the big mess that we are in now. President Obama himself said that it will take more than a term to fix the mess that the Bush administration left. Yes, it was the Republicans! Let's start the fixing by fixing the Congress.
I wonder if O'Donnell was invoking a spell or trying to satisfy herself...oh...I'm sorry...she doesn't believe in such stuff. Why is it a surprise she has NO CLUE about the Constitution?
I'm from AZ and I approve of Rodney's message!  With my vote!

And back, briefly, to Rand Paul's suggestion that he not share a stage with Conway again--

There are two possibilities. One, which you guys discount but don't refute, is that he really despises the man and doesn't want to give him the time of day. I simply make the suggestion that he may be sincere. I don't see why not. Conway is, after all, despicable.

The other possibility is that it's tactical. I could see this too. After your opponent is buried, or has buried himself, you may consider it best not to dig him up again. After all, Andrew Cuomo just did the same thing in New York. Complain about that, why don't you?
God bless the NRA and all the members for fighting to preserve our 2nd amendment rights under the United States Constitution. Their voting recommendations is what I will be taking to the polls.

And back, briefly, to Rand Paul's suggestion that he not share a stage with Conway again--

There are two possibilities. One, which you guys discount but don't refute, is that he really despises the man and doesn't want to give him the time of day. I simply make the suggestion that he may be sincere. I don't see why not. Conway is, after all, despicable.

The other possibility is that it's tactical. I could see this too. After your opponent is buried, or has buried himself, you may consider it best not to dig him up again. After all, Andrew Cuomo just did the same thing in New York. Complain about that, why don't you?

Re #2 SamBam
<<I hope he will have the good sense to retire before he completely destroys what little good will and reputation he still possesses.>>

Too late.
